intro: Xylopia oxypetala, commonly known as the sharp-leafed xylopia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, rough-textured bark and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, followed by round, fleshy fruits containing several seeds. Xylopia oxypetala is often found in humid, lowland forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
